key_points: Rioters breached the U.S. Capitol during the certification of the presidential election, raising security concerns.
Questions were raised about the readiness of the Capitol Police given the previously peaceful nature of pro-Trump demonstrations.
Steven Sund, Capitol Police Chief, resigned after admitting the attack was unprecedented in his 30-year career.
More than 50 police officers were injured during the riot, and there were fatalities among both officers and rioters.
The tactics used by rioters at the Capitol resembled those seen in 2020 riots across multiple U.S. cities.
Antifa and Black Lives Matter protests in 2020 involved similar violent tactics but were often portrayed as peaceful by mainstream media.
The Capitol riot may have been influenced by the perceived lack of repercussions for violent protesters in 2020.
Measures are being taken to secure the Capitol for the presidential inauguration, including additional fencing and National Guard deployment.
There is a call for rioters to be fully prosecuted to prevent recurrence of such violence.
The article suggests that leniency toward violent protests in 2020 contributed to the Capitol riot.
